page.title: 08The Mountbatten Centre.
page.content: The Centre was named on 9th. June 1982 by HRH The Prince of Wales in memory of Admiral of the Fleet Earl Mountbatten of Burma, Governor and later Lord Lieutenant of the island 1965-1979. This centre is a community project incorporating Medina High School, Adult Education, Medina Recreation Centre, Medina Theatre and Medina Community Association. The High School comprises four Faculty Blocks - Humanities, Science, Creative Arts and Sixth Form Centre and offers adult education courses ranging from Art to Weaving.The Recreation Centre includes swimming pools, outside pitches, gymnasium and sauna.The theatre is used for professional and amateur productions including ballet, music and drama.
